thread.title: Centara Maldives’ Underwater Symposium

author: Assignment Editor
title: Centara Maldives’ Underwater Symposium
text:
Centara Hotels and Resorts Maldives (Centara Grand Island Resort and Spa Maldives & Centara Ras Fushi Resort & Spa Maldives) celebrated International Day for the preservation of the Ozone Layer 2015 and the 30th Anniversary of Vienna Convention by holding an underwater symposium at the depth of eight metres at a reef known as “Thoshihaa” (a nearby reef that surrounds Centara Grand Island Resort & Spa Maldives) on September 16, 2015. This is the deepest underwater gathering of this kind to ever take place in the Maldives. 
The symposium pledged more emphasis and commitment by Centara Hotels & Resorts Maldives on alignment with global resolutions to reduce carbon emissions. The symposium was concluded after 10 management officials from both properties of Centara Hotels and Resorts Maldives signed a treaty to significantly reduce carbon emission in the next six years. On this treaty, Centara Hotels and Resorts Maldives declares to uphold the on-going initiatives to protect the ozone layer, reduce carbon emission by implementing specific activities and programs along with further investing in green technologies over the next six years. 
Mr. Abdulla Mohamed Didi, Deputy Minister of Ministry of Environment in the Maldives and Mr. Sergio Arias, Resident Manager of Centara Grand Island Resort and Spa Maldives inaugurated the event. Additionally, officials from Ministry of Environment and Ministry of Tourism were also in attendance under the sea.
